snippet: As reports mounted that the new Taliban leader, Mullah Akhtar Muhammad Mansour, had been shot, an insurgent spokesman took pains to buy time.
abstract: Taliban officials promise to release audio recording of leader Mullah Akhtar Muhammad Mansour to prove he is still alive; dismiss reports that Mullah Mansour had been killed in gunfight between rival insurgent factions in Afghanistan.

byline.original: By ROD NORDLAND and AHMAD SHAKIB
byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Taimoor Shah from Kandahar, Afghanistan; Farooq Jan Mangal from Khost, Afghanistan; Mujib Mashal from Kabul; and Ihsanullah Tipu Mehsud from Islamabad, Pakistan.

lead_paragraph: As reports mounted that the new Taliban leader, Mullah Akhtar Muhammad Mansour, had been shot, an insurgent spokesman took pains to buy time.

headline.main: Taliban Say They Will Release Recording of Leader to Prove He Is Alive
headline.print_headline: Taliban Say They Will Release Audio Recording of Leader to Prove He Is Alive
